text: a fantastic place with beautiful views of downtown , both sunrise and sunset views , interesting gardens and exhibition , galleries , boutique shops and eateries inside the main building , connecting to mrt too .

the foot bath seating is too small , can only accommodate few peoples .
The nature is incredible , I hiked for about 3 hours , met lots of monkeys and other animals and sometimes other hikers .
If you love animals and want to take picture as close as you can , always be alert that these wild animals can always snatch your camera / phone .
the scenery is really nice plus the weather was solid at that time , not too hot , not rainning just chill vibes all around we arrive her at 8 30 am so for your future refference .
good for kids , also open space for adults to chill out , get some breeze , or just afternoon walk
But there are shady ares in which one can sit and relax , and there are food outlets for those needing them .
there must be cafeteria selling very affordable food and drinks for the man living with no shelter .
respect the place by being quiet , dont hurt the animals , dont pick flowers randomly and please be quiet .
pity there are no shelter but there are some shops nearby for toilet or water breaks .
Plenty of scenic spots to sit in the heat and the cool house and the mist house were were beautifully laid out with spectacular displays .
The first time I spent a couple of hours reading all the well - laid out signages ( Singapore loves signages !)
. i suggest reading the map in front of the building so that you can determine the priority of the place so that it is optimal before the scorching hot sun at noon or dark at night .
A few nice outdoor eating cafe s open early around 7 am for breakfast .
The cafe next to the visitor centre was a great place to have breakfast ( breakfast menu stops at 11 am ).
but if you re wanting to eat simple , the spice cafe will the place you want to be !
to add to the guilt , it ends at spize cafe which has a lovely lunch menu .
quiet river view park can explore wild animals here .
tickets plus park car 1 large and 2 small sgd 98 to transfer from mrt khanit station to the zoo , you need to buy a ticket at a convenience store .
Its free to enter and has a few cafes , toilets and restaurants inside .
Another good thing is that there are plenty of offerings from the various restaurants , kiosks and stores !
Lots to see and do during the day , great restaurants , conveniently located near Orchard Road and accessible by the new Botanic Gardens MRT station on the Circle line .
Do look out for the obscure sign to turn into Catchment Trail .
The nature tour guide Ms Alyce WhatsApp me the google map location of the car park where our bus should alight .
strolling in the secluded path , you can get in close contact with these endangered wild animals from time to time .
I made my way to the main visitor centre at the Nassim Gate so I could get my hands on a paper map .

Only criticism we had was the offices to the National Parks were shut tightly and we had no way of getting our way around so based on the posted signs we eventually found what we wanted in a rounabout way !
I wish there had been a few more signs to help the public get the full story of the place .
Okay , so get yourself to Harbourfront MRT on the NorthEast line ( easier to navigate public transport here than the Tube in London , lots of signs everywhere ).
Start at Faber Peak and follow the signs to Henderson Wave .

some shelters also have toilets and vending machine to buy drinks at their own convenience .
fully flat but not wheelchair accessible due to slopes .
an interesting park connector to kent ridge & telok blangah .
recommend using the toilet there as there are no toilets during the journey .
It is very quiet in the forest , so you can hear the birds chirping away , and sounds of the waves around the island .
It was interesting to see the old gravestones and see how many people died at a very young age in the 1800 s .
Relatively quiet in the day but much more interesting at night with all the buildings lit up .
Easily spend 2 - 3 hours roaming around and taking in the peace and quiet .

Either way take the time to notice the wildlife that surrounds you , from monkeys that you can get quite close to ( some are friendly than others : O ) to huge forest ants , lizards , birds and more .
While sitting there , close your eyes and feel the warm sun on your skin , birds chipping , smells the sweet floral from the variety of flowers around you .
this is a recommended walk for those who want some peace and quiet .
nice quiet park to walk and relax

Make sure you dress comfortably and light as there is a lot of walking but there are benches everywhere and you get to sit and meditate and just enjoy the beauty of this place while the birds are singing .
this place is quiet and peaceful , lots of nice secnary and wildlife to see .
It is very therapeutic hearing the birds chirping , waterfall and smelling the floral fragrance around you .
Suffice to say , beautiful , serene and a treat for the senses .
peaceful place to silent and to praying place very near from pasir ris mrt inter change
very calming and a good place to mediate
good for relaxation but be prepared of the crowd
don t forget to follow the signs and don t feed the birds .
a wonderful place where u can spend 1 to 2 hour leisurely walking and enjoy the bright sun shine n fresh air
large crowds on saturday and sunday , otherwise very peaceful .
it s a great place to go for walks and it s very natural and peaceful .
quite a peaceful place for relaxing
While my husband an I weren t quite so enamoured , we enjoyed strolling around the gardens and lake .
There is also a large - ish lake , but the open areas and the heat at times can drive you down , unless you are from the tropics .
you can park your car here , take a cool rest next to a lake and have some good food from or opposite gombak mrt .

tiny island park on my backyard . always loving it . good time away from crowd !!
my routine of walking on weekends . must visit . and spend evening to see sunset at reservoir .

you can catch the skyline of johor bahru from the park and the jetty .
Changi Beach Park - quite ironic , the beach was closed but the park and its wildlife stood proudly on display .
The area is away from the hustle and bustle of Singapore itself and is a good spot to get away for a day or 2 The actual beach park is pleasant for an hour or 2 strolling along the waterfront .
This place comprises of a beach and a park .
quiet and elegant , with the fragrance of birds and flowers .
beautiful place , one of my fav , good place to unwind and relax and catch some sea breeze .
always fun with the sea breeze and fresh air .

There are so many locations of interest to visit such as Raffles Terrace , the Keramat Iskander Syah , the archaeoloical excavation site , Fort Canning Centre , the Fort gate , the Battle Box , Spice Garden - history , culture , heritage - this place has it all .
Keep a lookout for tropical plants , fruits , insects and what not !
The insects buzz throughout the day so a good insect repellent is a must .
it is rich in biodiversity and all sorts of insects can be found here .
All in all a great day out but make sure that you apply insect repellant I ended up with 22 mosquito bites and my wife about 12 mosquito bites .
sand on the beach is very nice , a bit unfortunate that there are lots of trash along the beach , hence unable to get too close to water .

Ease of Ascent : Bukit Timah , as a pedestrian stroll , is much improved since seven years ago , when hikers climbed up ( and even more carefully down ) a steep and deeply - rutted dirt trail that was treacherous when dry and homicidal when wet .
while some toilets are too dim , some toilets are smelly even before you step into itmmay need to work on this .
We were surprised by a few rainfalls - typical for Singapore - but could hide in a few shelters that were located in the clean and well tended gardens .
I went there this weekend with my husband and the ambience is so fantastic , full of greenary and the garden is well maintained and very clean .
So relaxing and clean , it s a perfect place to come and spend a quiet , relaxing day .
The gardens are clean well maintained and pathways are well signposted .
I can spend whole day there just enjoying the nature of all colors and greens , very clean and well done , can jog , picnic with friends or just relax .
It s very clean , and fantastic to help keep cool on a hot day .
Lots to see and as clean as Singapore can get !,,, nice cafe , was there 3 hours and it was enough , mainly sue ro the heat
quiet clean and serene fresh air , great park for exercise running jogging walking .
great big park with a few kilometres of road that runs alonside a clean and green river .
nice wind , clean place and also have nice bar near the beach , boat club and etc .
the playground has a beautiful environment , clean grounds , safe and reliable sports equipment and children s play equipment .

this is my favourite spot , destination of my walking exercise location , especially in the morning hour , enjoy cool breeze , after exercise , not to worry , there is proper & clean wash rooms for changing or wash up .
cycling and walking is fun on weekdays , not much crowd and the coast is clean .
as compared neighbouring country , good parking facilities , good f & b outlet , clean beach & toilet .
with long and clean runway and seats for resting at regular intervals , it is very convenient for simple workout activities like jogging , cycling and group cardio workout .
there s a full basketball court , exercise machines , swings , toddler s play area , benches and seats to relax in , and not least , the clean luscious foilage and well manicured greenery .
clean and green with many outdoor gym designed for ippt and senior .
